advisory: To manage the fall army worm pest, spray biopesticide Beauveria bassiana @ 1200-gram/acre by mixing in 200- litre of water. Use 10-12 bird perches per acre and remove them before tasselling stage. Dust mixture of sand, soil, and wooden ash inside the leaf whorl to prevent caterpillars from feeding on the leaves. For chemical control, spray Emamectin Benzoate 5 % S.G @ 80-gram/acre or Spinetoram 11.7% S.C @ 100-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

To manage Blast disease, spray Hexaconazole 5 % SC @ 400-ml/acre or Azoxystrobin 18.2% + Difenoconazole 11.4 % S.C @ 200-ml/acre or Tebuconazole 50%+ Trifloxystrobin 25 % WG @ 80-gram/acre. To manage Leaf Folder and Case Worm pests in paddy, spray Bifenthrin 10% EC @ 200 ml/acre or Lambda Cyhalothrin 5% EC @ 200-ml/acre or Fipronil 5% SC @ 400-ml/acre or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 60-ml /acre.
Pink stem borer management: Early transplant seedlings, remove and destroy affected bushes, use traps and sticks, apply beneficial insects and natural sprays.
Due to high temperature and humidity, there are reports of incidence of sucking pest like Aphids and Jassids in Cotton crop. Regular monitoring and neem-based pesticide sprays recommended.
In prevailing weather conditions, infestation of Mealy bug may be observed. Spray neem-based pesticide at initial stage of infestation.
To manage Shoot and fruit borer, remove affected parts, install traps, and use chemical control with specified insecticides at intervals.
As grasses are high in moisture content during rainy days, provide adequate dry matter to dairy animals.
After stocking, provide proper feed, check pH and water temperature, purify pond water regularly.
To prevent bird flu, maintain cleanliness, change feed and water frequently, and dispose of dead birds properly.
